website_summaries.verdict: If you’re looking for an entertaining toy that will keep big birds busy for more than 5 minutes, this is a solid choice. Big, sturdy, and priced right.
pros: Chunky wooden blocks give destructive birds something to really sink their beaks into
Brainy birds can enjoy untying the knots
Large dimensions encourage climbing and swinging
cons: Especially destructive larger birds might still be able to shred it within a week or 2

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this toy for your parrot
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT purchase. This is NOT an appropriately sized toy for my Macaw as it was advertised & appears in the photo. The wood is cheap, the colors blead and my bird was able to chew this thing up completely in less than 5 minutes. Very misleading marketing of this product. I would have returned it for a refund if my bird hadn’t destroyed it so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: My Green Wing Macaw is impressed...
customer_reviews.text: I have a large Green Wing Macaw. Normally, when I hang a new toy in his cage, he spends the next hour or two ignoring it and then the following 30 minutes reducing it to splinters and frayed rope, usually leaving only a single chain hanging in its place. When I hung this toy in his cage, he immediately went at it. It's now some 7 hours later, and he's been gnawing on that thing on and off. But aside from an impressive pile of rubble in the bottom of the cage, the toy looks pretty much unscathed. THAT'S impressive!! ;o) In all seriousness, I wholeheartedly recommend this behemoth to anyone with a larger bird. It's well worth the px.
customer_reviews.author: LLShopper

customer_reviews.title: It serves its purpose. Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had been meaning to post a review about this ladder. I actually bought it from here back in 2017. I keep it hung on the inside of my 10yr old Conure’s cage so that when he’s inside, he can have something to perch and chew on while he stares and squawks profanities at people all day. When I first bought it, he was really apprehensive about touching it, but after some time (I say about 2-3 weeks) he learned that it was a safe toy, and has been showing interest in it (on and off) since. The toy is very durable and is still holding up after all these years. I highly recommend, great buy.
customer_reviews.author: kemmiel

customer_reviews.title: I use to buy these a lot because my Lovebirds ...
customer_reviews.text: I use to buy these a lot because my Lovebirds would tear them up. However I recently inspected the chain on the inside of the blocks and found MAJOR CORROSION. I do not believe the chain is being made out of anything is suppose to stand the test of time and can only guess that there is rust forming on the inside of these. If you buy this, make sure you replace them often or inspect the inside chain for debries.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Anselmo

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: First of all...no part of this toy should be classified as "XXL". It is a medium at best! My cockatoo tore it up in 10 minutes. Its more suited for a small conure or something along those lines..definitely NOT for any larger parrot!
customer_reviews.author: Ann-MarieTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Bad smelling toy
customer_reviews.text: We have been ordering bird toys for over 26 years from a company made in the USA and this is the first time we had ever ordered one made in china. The smell was so bad it was nauseating and gave us a headache and had to throw it out after 3 days of hanging it in our bird room, our birds would not touch it. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Nemesis

customer_reviews.title: Kermie the Quaker Approves of this Toy!
customer_reviews.text: So far, he hasn't managed to kill this one! Kermie the Quaker is a chewer and many toys have gone into his cage to meet their rapid demise. This one has quite a bit of wood and thick ropes that has kept him busy for hours and has, so far, held it's own. It's a nice, large size, so I anticipate many hours of play ahead for him with his new chew toy. Surprisingly, he went right to this one, too... it usually takes him a couple of hours to size up the new invaders to his domain, but he hopped right on this one and went to swinging. Maybe he's mellowing in his old age?
customer_reviews.author: Crissi (Fraz Zled Momma to Many)

customer_reviews.title: Good for medium sized birds, NOT large Macaws or cockatoos.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, fun chewing toy, but it is not suitable for cockatoos and Macaws. The pear link used to hang the toy is too weak. A cockatoo or a Macaw can bend it and it can create a hazard for the bird once it is bent. I changed the pear link to a heavier C-link and gave the toy to a Macaw. The toy was totally gone in an hour. The toy is good for birds like Amazons and African Greys, but large Macaws and most cockatoos have too strong a bite for that pear link to be considered safe.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Good for Mid-sized to Large Birds
customer_reviews.text: We've bought this twice now--once for my conure who will probably keep it forever and enjoys playing with the frayed knots on it, and once for my G2, who is already starting to shred it to pieces. When he does, we'll probably buy it again. So far, it's lasted about three weeks and still seems to be going strong. The wood is very 'crisp' and 'hollow' so they aren't solid, thick blocks of wood. The break very easily, so smaller and mid-sized birds could probably break them, evne though the size of the toy overall is large. I'd recommend it. It's a quality bird toy--just be sure to replace the metal quick link at the top with something safer.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle (Michy) Devon

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it for a couple days of entertainment.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the first time I've purchased this. My sun conure loves them. Dosen't last long only 2 or 3 days but he enjoys tearing it apart. Many hours of quiet time for me lol. It is very large and at first he was afraid of it but after a couple days of it being on his play stand he started to get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: ValMarc

customer_reviews.title: Parrots love them but not recommended for larger birds.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 Parrots love knots so I thought these would make great toys. The one in the males cage was totally destroyed down to the chain in less than 4 hours but I guess he really enjoyed it. The one in the females cage is mostly in tact but she seems to enjoy it as well. I wish the wooden blocks were made of harder wood so that they would last longer. That said, I couldn't recommend this toy for any parrot unless it is smaller than an African Grey unless you want to replace them often. These were the medium size and I'm wondering if the large size uses harder wood. As for the Parrots opinion... bring them on!
customer_reviews.author: RobMars

customer_reviews.title: Great for large parrots.
customer_reviews.text: This toy is perfect for large parrots. Colorful and well made. I have a blue and gold macaw and this toy gives him weeks of fun until there is time for another. Have purchased several as replacements as it is difficult to find toys that are large enough and that last longer than a few days.
customer_reviews.author: charzrevolution

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for large birds
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this toy many times at Petco for a lot more. My cockatoo loves this toy so much that he usually has it destroyed in no time. He loves anything with colorful wood and therefore we have lots of the nylon knots to repurpose into another toy. He usually could care less about toys if I'm home as he prefers to be out of the cage hanging with me. When I leave him in his cage to do errands, that's when he chews up this toy.
customer_reviews.author: kyranew

customer_reviews.title: I search out for the largest of the large toys for my Lesser Sulfur Crested Cockatoo as he is a mega chewer and shows a clear love for toys that are clearly at least twice his ...
customer_reviews.text: Much larger then I expected. I search out for the largest of the large toys for my Lesser Sulfur Crested Cockatoo as he is a mega chewer and shows a clear love for toys that are clearly at least twice his size. I think it feeds his ego- he believes himself to be a large Too. It has taken him a good amount of time to destroy. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Leeane D.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of texture and ways to attack it
customer_reviews.text: First of all: no toy is 100 percent safe. Supervise your bird, especially with new toys. Check toys daily and remove worn toys. Buy appropriately sized toys. I buy this medium toy for my Senegal who is a big chewer, she destroys the small ones in a day. I buy the large size for my two dwarf macaws, it keeps them busy for 5-7 days. My Grey won’t touch these, she is scared of them. This is the favorite toy for three years running. Just keep basic safety in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Parrot

customer_reviews.title: Small, cheap, & colors ran
customer_reviews.text: I received it & it was small. Smaller than 12” it claims to be. Ordered a couple & 1 came without the hook to hang with. She ripped through that thing in no time. Few of the scraps fell in her water & it changed the color of the water a lot. Not a light tint but it was a dark blue. Won’t be getting these again. Watch out! If you care for your bird get something else.
customer_reviews.author: ZM

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well with my six month old Macaw!
customer_reviews.text: My baby Blue and Gold loves this toy! It's on her cage rotation. I swap out her toys weekly to keep her from being bored. She loves the knots and runs them inside of her beak (must be the texture). The wood has also held up well to her strong Macaw beak. We've had for three months now (she's six months old) and it looks relatively new with every other week use. If you find my review, please indicate so with the voting buttons. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Lioness

customer_reviews.title: STRONG. HOLDS UP TO MY CRAZY MAKAW
customer_reviews.text: My Makaws are brutal on toys. ( especially the young ones) I was really amazed for the price how well it has stayed together. It has taken her over two months for one corner to start to come apart. I love it because she loves to get on her toys and swing and beat them up. I would purchase this again over and over because it really stood up to our crazy Scarlet !! See video. She really kicks her toys butts. LOL. TAKES A BEATING !!
customer_reviews.author: Native Amer Soap Artist

customer_reviews.title: Great for larger birds
customer_reviews.text: This was super nice but unfortunately I had to return it because it was simply too large for my cockatiel. The blocks were too thick and it was massive in her cage. That being said, it would make a great toy for a larger bird, especially the mid size parrots. It looked very sturdy and well put together.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive, too easy to destroy
customer_reviews.text: I had this on a bi-monthly subscription, but each time it ships it is more expensive. It's at least five dollars more than when I first started getting it. Also, although my cockatoo loves it, he destroys it to wood splinters in just a day, so it is just too expensive for a one-day treat.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C.

customer_reviews.title: Paradise toys have yet to disappoint. This one is much bigger than I had expected but my Amazon didn’t mind.
customer_reviews.text: This is BIG! I got it for my double-head Amazon and he was a little overwhelmed at first but took him about five minutes to dive in and attack. This should last him a lot longer than the others I bought and it is better quality with lots of fun colors and shapes to explore. And you will love the price! The pet store would have charged A LOT more. Thanks for a quality made toy my parrot loves!
customer_reviews.author: Diane T.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey chewed this all up: she loves it! I bought a bunch of toys at one time so I don't feel bad about her destroying her toy because I have another one I can give her. This is a good size for a medium-large bird like my grey, and a bigger macaw could enjoy it too. It is substantial enough to hang on. It's not too big for a smaller bird like a Senegal. They would enjoy swinging on it, and would take longer to chew through the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Garnet Back Together

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Ordered from Stock Your Home via Amazon. Item is smaller than pictured, has a splintered portion, and pieces flaked off much more than the typical amount.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for a large parrot!
customer_reviews.text: This toy was a great choice for our Blue and Gold Macaw! The wood pieces are thick enough so that it takes some effort on his part to chew through them. The knotted rope is another plus. It provides a chance for the bird to work at untying the knots and gives him lots of playtime.
customer_reviews.author: sd51

customer_reviews.title: My cockatoo easily breaks the wood apart but continues shredding each piece ...
customer_reviews.text: My umbrella cockatoo loves this toy! It will continue to be my "go-to" parrot toy as long as the price stays low. My cockatoo easily breaks the wood apart but continues shredding each piece into splinters so it lasts long enough to be worth it ;) Thank you Amazon! Great product & price!
customer_reviews.author: nemesioucr

customer_reviews.title: Grea, but not that sturdy for my birds
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Amazon parrots, one 4 years and the other about 3- 3 1/2. They loved it, 1st week the older one started playing with and by the second week the other joined (the younger one was scared of it at first). They bit the multi-colored blocks and untied the knots much quicker than I expected. It definitely got their attention and they made less noise at home. The only problem is their beaks were too strong and in 3 weeks they completely destroyed it, I would recommend this toy for any bird SMALLER than them. The chain used to hold the toy up is still in the cage and they bite it sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay Rampersadsingh

customer_reviews.title: My African Gray loves this toy. This is my ...
customer_reviews.text: My African Gray loves this toy. This is my second purchase. I made a mistake and got this very large one. He play with it but is a little afraid of the biggest wood blocks. He destroys the smaller wood pieces. I got the 16" version last time and will get that one again next time. But he still loves this toy. It just won't last as long because he won't chew on the really big wood pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Debmsw

customer_reviews.title: Cotton is deadly for birds
customer_reviews.text: Cotton is deadly for birds. As they play and chew, cotton fibers wear and fray and can cause an intestinal blockage. Instead of cotton look for polyester (it doesn't fray), sea grass or sisal.
customer_reviews.author: Mood Swings

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for a busy Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: My female Amazon is in her breeding cycle, and I cannot stock enough of these. Usually hanging toys languish around here (she prefers foot toys), but she DECIMATES this toy in the space of a few hours, which, as anyone with birds knows, is what you want them to be able to do. This toy keeps her mind and beak busy while satisfying her need to shred wood for a nest. As far as most parrot toys go, this is reasonably priced and well worth it for my bird's happiness!
customer_reviews.author: Maia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy for our mealy Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Our parrot loves this toy. We have a mealy Amazon, which is a large parrot. I will buy this again very soon, because Spooky is having a ball tearing this toy up. Highly recommend. It looks great in the cage, too. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Weagle

customer_reviews.title: Paradise Toy Knots and Blocks is our Double Yellow Head Amazon favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy our Double Yellow Amazon LOVES This toy is keeps him busy for hours. It took him a few months to total distory it. I tried another toy he (different one) he remained how to remove the pieces in 2days. I'm going to have to order this Paradise Toy Knots and Blocks and keep an extra one on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: My MaCaw won this battle
customer_reviews.text: My Blue and Gold MaCaw ripped through this thing in one day. I've purchased these from various sellers over the years and I'm not sure if my bird was just overly bored or if this is poor quality but it sure didn't last at my house.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Paradise Knots Block Chewing Toy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and received this Paradise Knots Block Chewing Toy from Caitec Corp. It is quite large for a small parrot to attack and devour, but I am sure my daughters two birds will succeed in destroying this toy like so many before. It is brightly colored and diverse in it's offerings to be chewed on and ripped apart. They like it.
customer_reviews.author: CDP's Onceagain habit of purchasingTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: They love it and its safe
customer_reviews.text: My rats go crazy for these. I have three in their cage. The large and medium are both durable, well-made and overall delicious for them. They love it and its safe.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: What a rip-off!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for my Macaw...absolutely dis-satisfied. There are only about 6 inches of blocks and the remainder is chain. Completely false advertising and pics of the toys. Can’t believe Amazon hasn’t done something about this ongoing problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Collett

customer_reviews.title: not 15 inches i measured 12 do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Only 12 inches long not 15 and there is a space of about 2 inches in the top where no blocks at all. Amazon should eliminate this item/seller
customer_reviews.author: PMP

customer_reviews.title: Rats love it too!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my rats- and they adore it! It really is big, much bigger than I anticipated, but it does fit between the levels in my girls' cage. Not only do they chew on it, they also use it as a climbing rope to get in and out of baskets and between levels
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart. Not properly put together.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't even put together. Pulled out of bag and half of it fell to the floor. Put other half in cage and that fell apart as soon as she barely touched it. Bad design
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett S.

customer_reviews.title: it keeps them occupied and i love that the wood pieces are seperated from each other ...
customer_reviews.text: First off i did not buy this for a bird or parrot. I bought these for my 2 prairie dogs. The exotic pet store i go to say that it"s safe for them to chew and play with. As soon as i put it in there cage they ran to play with it, it keeps them occupied and i love that the wood pieces are seperated from each other and not on one strand of rope. I say that because I've had some of the toys that have 6 wood blocks on one strand of rope and it is not fun after they chew the rope and all the wood lay on the bottom of the cage.
customer_reviews.author: Farah

customer_reviews.title: Best wooden toy for parrots ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy! Or I should say my African Grey loves this toy. He is not caged up until night, he goes from cage to walking over to his huge tree. He has several toys and bells etc But works 3/4 of his day on this toy. He loves the knots to untie chew on the wood. This is the 3rd or 4th one I’ve gotten him. He never gets bored with it. Please don’t ever stop selling these!!
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Ehrlich

customer_reviews.title: Good Toy
customer_reviews.text: My Yellow Naped Amazon loves this toy! She is very particular but she took to this toy right away. It has lasted over a month but I think she'll have shredded all she wants to shred with this toy soon and I will have to replace it. The price of this is reasonable so I'll order two next time. The 13 inch long size is perfect for a medium sized parrot (Amazons, African Greys) who likes to sit on a perch and attack toys. If a parrot likes to climb on a toy while destroying it then the larger size might be better.
customer_reviews.author: lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my parrot busy.
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey LOVES this. He gets really happy when I open the box and he sees a new one. It takes him about 3-4 days to remove all the wood from the rope. He then enjoys destroying the wood blocks that are left on the bottom of his cage. I'd say this last him 2 weeks from destroying it on the rope to ripping apart what's fallen on the bottom of his cage in larger chunks.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Cardi

customer_reviews.title: My cockatoo’s favorite
customer_reviews.text: Good toy for my Umbrella cockatoo that actually lasts a long time. He chews the blocks first, then the cotton cords. His favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I really like this toy. My Caique isn’t much of a chewer but he loves the ropes and blocks. Toys are expensive and small but this one was good size and is still mint condition in the cage 6 months later.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Richards

customer_reviews.title: Nice bird toy!
customer_reviews.text: Well, my bird loves it! This is a nice sturdy toy for my brown headed parrot (poicephalus). It is tough enough that it lasts a while, but still fun and engaging. It is a good value toy for the money because it lasts a few weeks even with her chewing on it every day. A bigger bird would probably go through it pretty fast, but for a medium parrot it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fun toy for big birds
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for my cockatoo. This toy is big and lasted longer than most do for my bird. She is very destructive and toys do not last long for her. This one lasted a couple of days, which is good for her. She really loved this one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy, our yellow-naped macaw likes them
customer_reviews.text: Our yellow-naped macaw loves these, lasts anywhere from a few days to a few weeks depending on what else he has available. Toy has brightly-colored, thick wood. He doesn't destroy the cotton, so in theory we could reload it with more wood pieces as the chain base seems sturdy to survive longer. We opt to buy new toys, but having replacement wood available would be a good money-saving option. We like the convenience and craftsmanship and will buy more when he runs through this supply.
customer_reviews.author: Phade

customer_reviews.title: Our breeder mentioned that rats like bird toys so I thought we'd try it
customer_reviews.text: We actually bought this for our 3 rats. Our breeder mentioned that rats like bird toys so I thought we'd try it. They love it! They climb all over it like a jungle gym and chew on it as well. It is large so just make sure you measure your cage properly.
customer_reviews.author: DiDi

customer_reviews.title: Not For My Parrot
customer_reviews.text: The problem for me was the picture showing an African Gray with this toy. It is not made for a bird of that size. My girl destroyed it within an hour. Better suited for a smaller bird. I did notify the seller and was sent a new toy in its place.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for a parrot that loves to dismantle toys
customer_reviews.text: This was a fun toy for a parrot that loves to take on new challenges and dismantle toys like this. He loved it and it kept him busy for a long period. He was tired and slept like a baby after playing with it. Highly recommend if your bird likes toys with different fun activities available.
customer_reviews.author: SPTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Mealy Amazon loves these
customer_reviews.text: These are great toys for large parrots. This size is perfect for our old girl, not too big, but still a great workout for her. We love watching her tear it to pieces, and we also love that it takes some time to make that happen. Probably her favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Weagle

customer_reviews.title: My parakeet Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: My parakeet, Merlina, can be a little stand offish when it comes to new toys or any product that goes into her home. She liked this toy right away! She loves bright colors. She chews on the wood and the knots. She climbs on top of it. Great item!
customer_reviews.author: ZB

customer_reviews.title: Great pine toy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these for my Umbrella Cockatoo The wood is pine and smells fresh, no chemical smell.
customer_reviews.author: Fallon Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Product was exactly as stated
customer_reviews.text: There were a lot of negative reviews, but my items came exactly as described. It said that the shipping was going to take a lot longer than 2 days, but ended up only being one extra day. Great quality and great price. Would definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Finicky cockatiel LOVES this toy!
customer_reviews.text: My finicky cockatiel LOVES this toy! He can be so reserved and leave new items alone in his cage till I get tired of them and pull them out. He has climbed and swung on this since first put in his cage! Looks great, awesome toy!
customer_reviews.author: PasoCreek

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Birds like it. They enjoy chewing on it, swinging upside down while hanging from the rope pieces, and generally just playfully attacking it. Lasts longer than expected.... It's been in an outdoor enclosure for several months now, and its still mostly intact, and no discernable fading.
customer_reviews.author: DoveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great playtime toy
customer_reviews.text: My grandson's cockatoo loves this toy. She keeps undoing the knots and my grandson keeps re-doing them! Also loved the fact that it was not colored. My grandson said that he had a colored on once and she played with it after her bath when she was still wet and he had a rainbow birt! I know the colors attract birds but I don't trust the quality of the dyes used.
customer_reviews.author: AMKaloha

customer_reviews.title: Not what we needed for a McCaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice chew toy for smaller birds, but our McCaw went through it in a couple of days. Don't buy this for a McCaw. For a smaller bird, it should be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: drjim

customer_reviews.title: my parakeet really loves this!
customer_reviews.text: she loves it! I took it apart as it's too large for a parakeet, so I'm just giving her one section at a time. I like this as I can toss this when it gets dirty and give her a clean new piece. she never chewed a toy as much as she does this one so for that I'm very happy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy A. Stamp

customer_reviews.title: Paying for less than half the size of the pictured product
customer_reviews.text: My Cockatoo loves this toy. I buy it retail for the same price and the length is correct. The times I have ordered it with another order to save time, it comes in the small size. I do learn that it is worth the trip to the store for this toy. I buy knots and blocks every couple of months and am aware of what it should be. It's up to the bird whether they like it or not.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Becher

customer_reviews.title: Umbrella Cockatoo loves it
customer_reviews.text: My Umbrella Cockatoo loves this and chews on the wood throughout the day. In fact, I'm going to order another one right now, since he's down to just a few small pieces left. This is nice and large and has lots of wood to chew.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t leave birds unattended when playing with toys,
customer_reviews.text: My umbrella cockatoo loves it, but if it gets wet, the color dye comes off on her feathers, she looks tie dyed. Made with vegetable dye and will not hurt your bird.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Macaw B&G
customer_reviews.text: Nice size chunks of wood and links. Links very important so their claws don’t get caught. If small links I wouldn’t buy. I keep a mini bolt cutter just in case . Rather loose the toy than a exspensive vet visit.
customer_reviews.author: P. Marino

customer_reviews.title: Good For Macaws.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice toy.Its good for Macawas.For smaller birds such AG and Amazon it will last longer.:) My African Gray is 11months old so its a little big for him.He plays with it and has destroyed a couple of wooden pieces already.I recomend it .This toy will keep your bird busy.
customer_reviews.author: Roma Grey

customer_reviews.title: Half of this toy becomes useless.
customer_reviews.text: My Amazon loves it. But I have a problem. Most of his chewing is on the large squares. When enough of the square is gone the little ropes & sticks fall to the ground. Half of this toy becomes useless.
customer_reviews.author: Georgianna

customer_reviews.title: It was hanging and we didn't even give it to ...
customer_reviews.text: It was hanging and we didn't even give it to the bird yet it fell apart and when I went to throw the wooden peices away the dye was coming off all over my hands
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: My birds love this toy. They have such a hard time destroying it which keeps them busy. I'll be ordering another one when they do finally destroy it.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Basit

customer_reviews.title: The U2 Demi who owns us is most pleased with tearing this to pieces
customer_reviews.text: The U2 Demi who owns us is most pleased with tearing this to pieces, her eyes roll back with every new block she breaks in. The carnage of wood splinters after a good 6 weeks shows how long this toy lasts for our chewy cockatoo. 5 out of 5 crazy cockatoo head bobs.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Landon

customer_reviews.title: Cockatoo approved!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present for my spoiled Cockatoo. I wrapped it and hung it on his play gym. He had a great time shredding the paper Christmas morning. Then he discovered the toy! He hasn't left it alone since then. Usually a toy lasts him 2 or 3 days, but this one has so much to it that he is still enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Amitola Acres

customer_reviews.title: ... Cockatoo loves to chew so these (notice plural) were fun for him
customer_reviews.text: My Elenora Cockatoo loves to chew so these (notice plural) were fun for him. He demolished one a day til they were all (3) gone. They are great "busy" chew toys just don't expect them to last very long. Considering the price, I will keep a few of these on hand for special treats and rewards.
customer_reviews.author: S. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: parrot therapy  great  toy !
customer_reviews.text: Totally the only toy my greater sulfur crested cockatoo will play with ....... she spend hours deconstructing these . Is funny how such a simple configuration can be so entertaining to her and so affordable to me ! will buy lots more !
customer_reviews.author: jeramy  r.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and large.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great large parrot toy. I didn't realize how big it was going to be, perfect for my umbrella cockatoo.I am going to buy another one for my African Grey.
customer_reviews.author: K. Swales

customer_reviews.title: I have an Umbrella Cockatoo, and my U2 has ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an Umbrella Cockatoo, and my U2 has several of these types of toys hanging in her cage. She obviously loves this one the most, because in less than a week of having this in her cage, she has really done a number on it! Most of the visible white rope knots have been chewed away, and about half of the wooden pieces are chewed to almost nothing. At this rate, I don't think it's going to last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Borow

customer_reviews.title: A great shredding toy.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little shocked at first how large this toy was, especially for a medium-sized Timneh Grey parrot, but the size ended up being a good thing and the bird loves chewing on this toy from multiple perches. The wood is medium-soft, easy for a medium parrot to shred, and so far has held up well. My bird has figured out that chewing the larger central pieces first will cause the side pieces to simply detach and fall off, but I end up recycling toy parts, so it's no great loss.
customer_reviews.author: Miech

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy for an Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better toys I've purchased for my bird. I have an Amazon parrot and this gives him hours and hours of chew and destroy time. My bird usually goes through the toys pretty quick but this is much more challenging to him.
customer_reviews.author: William of Florida

customer_reviews.title: Color not as seen in photo.
customer_reviews.text: Really like the item. My budgie seems to like it as well. Only issue I had was the colors were not like the one in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: My bird has been happily side tracked chewing the toy to pieces
customer_reviews.text: My bird has been happily side tracked chewing the toy to pieces. The toy will not last long at this pace which makes it an expensive toy. I might try getting one that has different shapes since he tends to no destroy those as quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jass411

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it and better fit than the one from pet store! Cheaper too...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a larger version of this type of toy from the pet store, but it was too big for the cage, and the red ropes kept dying our birds' feathers red, so we decided to try this one and love it! Much better fit for our cage, and doesn't turn our birds' beautiful white feathers red!
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: We love this thing
customer_reviews.text: My parrots told me to tell you guys the following: "Squak, skwalk screech, (flap flap), squalk, screech (poop) whistle, shriek, woohoo, skwalk, sqalllk, whistle shriek, woohoo, "bad word" WOWWW, shriek!" (Translation: We love this thing, it's awesome and fun (s'cuse me, I have to poop...ahhh, that's good...all done, right on the floor totally missed the paper mommy put down, now where was I?) Oh yeah, I fully approve of this fine offering of a toy and hope to get another one for two since I seem to love destroying my toys making maximum mess directly proportionate to the fun it is playing with it, and rightfully recommend this for your birdy needs.
customer_reviews.author: skar

customer_reviews.title: Good bird toy
customer_reviews.text: My bird absolutely loves it, however she has it chewed up in two days. I need something that lasts a little longer then that. But it's well made and she had fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Grandmom Connie

customer_reviews.title: Great for rats too !
customer_reviews.text: My rats immediately started sniffing and chewing. They love it!
customer_reviews.author: Shaylen Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Bird toy
customer_reviews.text: Wow this thing is huge I think in time my 2 Macaws will love chewing this up
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy - African Grey loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent toy. Purchased for my friend's African Grey...she loves it. Already purchased 2 more to have on hand for her Christmas present (plus a back-up for another day) Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Zee in CA

customer_reviews.title: Great for Rabbits and Guinea Pigs
customer_reviews.text: this is good for rodents and rabbits too. the guinea pigs love it and so did the rabbit. I purchased another one for My chinchillas. It's about this size of a fully grown guinea pig so It should not be used in small cages or for hamsters or gerbils.
customer_reviews.author: anne sueTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for an Umbrella cockatoo!
customer_reviews.text: Best toy I've found so far for my umbrella cockatoo. Bought it 4x's now, i believe. Lasts pretty long. When she's done, there will be nothing left but the chain!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn D

customer_reviews.title: My chinchillas LOVE it and I do too
customer_reviews.text: wayy bigger than I expected! But SO worth the price! My chinchillas LOVE it and I do too, because it’s gonna last them quite a while! (Chinchillas are big chewers and always need new toys!)
customer_reviews.author: Zangief

customer_reviews.title: My African Grey LOVED this toy
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey LOVED this toy!! As soon as I put it in her cage she was after it! It only lasted about 3 days as she 'played with, chewed it, and tore it up' pretty constantly. Well worth the cost for the joy it brought 'BuBo'!
customer_reviews.author: The Zoo Keeper

customer_reviews.title: One of my Cockatoo's favorites
customer_reviews.text: My cockatoo loves this toy when I buy it for her. She always goes crazy on it the first couple of days, but then the rest of the toy typically lasts her for another 2 or 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Noble

customer_reviews.title: Blue and Gold Macaw- best priced bird toy out there, but course rope
customer_reviews.text: My bird loves this! He does break the wood pieces apart and they are not super soft so it takes him more time to tear it apart. The rope in the toy is course, so he does not spend as much time on the rope. Experts say rope toys deter a bird from plucking, but the rope is too course so he is not inclined to play with it. If you are looking for a toy that will take the bird longer to get through (and distract from plucking), I recommend ones with a softer rope/big knots.
customer_reviews.author: W. Ehresman

customer_reviews.title: Chew Toys
customer_reviews.text: My parrot loves his chew toys and this one is no exception! The wood is soft and he goes through it fast so that is why I only gave it three stars!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Miles Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Our parrot loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We have a very large parrot and he loves this toy. Has already chewed half of it. Price was also a factor. Got a great big bird toy for a reasonable price. Will be buying again!
customer_reviews.author: C.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have a Blue Crown Conure with a larger cage. He loves this toy. This works well both in and on top of his cage. It is bright and colorful. In the cage I think that he likes the privacy it gives him, he likes to sit behind it and peek around. It was a GREAT value, same item goes for $18-$25 in pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: TammyRN

customer_reviews.title: Great bird toy!
customer_reviews.text: My birds love this toy. I bought this larger item for lovebirds because they chew on everything they can and small toys are a waste of money. This one is keeping them very busy and not submitting to destruction without resistance. It's been a month and 97% still remains, not bad for a 12 bird demolition team. Well made
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller measurements than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Product not as advertised. This toy only measures 3 inches by 9 inches. NOT 4” by 13”. This is much smaller than anticipated and not for medium/large or large birds.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Totally misrepresented size.
customer_reviews.text: Totally misrepresented size. Now I need to spend my time and money to return it for a return or replacement. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: M2

customer_reviews.title: Half price compared to pet stores!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy, and it's less than half price here than at the pet store. Although the design isn't perfect, it's pretty decent and I collect the bigger chunks of toys that they drop and use them as foot toys later. My cockatoo also likes to play with the rope pieces after the toy is destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: Chantilly Lace

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bright Toy to Keep them Busy !
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun toy with lots of ropes and blocks to keep our Yellow Naped Amazon busy. He loves this toy and he has played with it a lot ! I would buy again and highly recommend this toy !
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui

customer_reviews.title: now you see it, soon you won't
customer_reviews.text: Look fast. Our African Grey acts like a wood chipper, but that's what they do. He seems to enjoy it and if you have a Grey you know that toy's have to sacrifice their lives to keep them busy
customer_reviews.author: Harold R. Lingo

customer_reviews.title: Kept my Macaw busy, can't ask more from a toy!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for our macaw. Took our bird a month to get through this toy which is a feat for our bird. Good materials and gave my blue throated macaw hours upon hours of enjoyment. Depending on the activity level of your bird will dictate how long this toy lasts but lets face it the toys are meant to be destroyed. If it gets chewed up then it did its job and my bird obviously liked it. Good product that we liked very much. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: KDF

customer_reviews.title: This is a great toy for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for the price! It's a good size for my two Amazons and they love destroying the wood blocks. I buy a few at a time when I'm ordering other items since it's half the price of similarly sized toys.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

product_meta.title: Featherland Paradise, Knots 'N Blocks, Multicolored/Natural Bird Toy for Playing, Chewing, Preening
product_meta.description: Size:Extra LargeYour favorite bird will flap their wings with joy when you hang the Paradise Knots Block Chewing Toyin their birdcage. Multi-colored hanging wood blocks give Mr. or Ms. Bird lots of quality chewing time. The knots provide a good challenge and smart birds can actually untie them. The chew toy also helps Birdy look good for their bird friends by allowing them to preen to their hearts content. Buy a Paradise Knots Block Chewing Toyproduct and make your fine feathered friend happy. Makes a great Christmas, birthday, or holiday gift for a bird-loving friend.
feature_bullets: Your Bird Will Love this Knots and Blocks Chewing Toyin Vibrant Colors;it fosters interactive play and encourages your bird to Swing, Climb, and StayActive; Knots Can Be Untied by Clever Birds
Your bird will have an Exceptional Quality Time Gnawing and Chomping on the Colorful Wood Blocks with Multiple Layers to Climb and Explore; our Unique Designentices your bird to Pick, Pull, and Preen

A combination of Festive Wood Blocks and Knots were designed to keep your best Bird Happy and Busy for hours; materials are perfect for Chewing and Preening;encourages parrots to Preen and Condition Beak

Make your bird cage into a Bird Playground or Bird Gym;Individual wooden shapes and fabric textures Stimulate Both Beak and Foot Activity; the Multi Colored Wood Blocks and knotted rope provides Birdy with Plenty of Exercise
Created from Pet Safe Materials, including 100% Cotton Rope and Natural Sisal Rope; attaches easily to cage with a Quick Link Fastener; makes a Great Gift for the Bird Lover in Your Life
